status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.description:
Opening this to track an ssl issue we're all of a sudden seeing frequently in QA/CI runs during upload bundle; "SSLV3_ALERT_HANDSHAKE_FAILURE".
I've seen this occur on the first 'part' being uploaded as well as in the middle  after many parts have been uploaded. 
There are possible work arounds which exist in some but not all of the tools (euca2ools) for adding retries. This may end up being a tools side issue but since it's not seen or being reported with ec2 I'm opening the ticket against Euca to start. 
I think this could affect the following utilities:
euca-upload-bundle
euca-bundle-and-upload-image
euca-import-volume
euca-import-instance
euca-bundle-instance
Thanks, 
-M

comments.body: May relate to S3 change that recently went in, which closes the connection on each request. Let's wait until the related ticket is resolved and then chase this.

After fixing EUCA-12401, I still see this error, running the shell script in [~sjones]'s comment "I could cause a similar failure using OpenSSL:". It fails after 66 iterations the first time, and after 80 the second time.

Also, in my concise2 regression run using the code that includes the EUCA-12401 fix, the nephoria-load-bfebs-image and nephoria-legacy-ebs-suite tests failed:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/nephoria-load-bfebs-image/382/consoleFull
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/nephoria-legacy-ebs-suite/369/consoleFull
Do these failures match the reported issue here?

Hi [~lincoln.thomas]
Adding a little more info in regards to the "legacy-ebs-suite" snapshot failure noted above. The cloud-error log output for that failure is below. The logs show lots of the following errors for multiple services: "No such endpoint: vm://<servicetype> in endpoints=[]". Not sure if this is similar to EUCA-12401?

Hi [~lincoln.thomas], 
Little more info on the 'load-bfebs-image' test failure above...
Looks like the instance used to create the image never made it to running state.
The test times out and terminates the the pending vm after ~10 minutes, however the nc.log shows the create and terminate requests come in within about 2 minutes of eachother. Not sure if the create took ~8 minutes to show up in nc.log?
 Looks like there was multiple attempts to create the instance shown in 'httpd-node_error_log', and some blobstore errors in /var/log/messages assuming at cleanup, maybe the artifact is not created and later found? 
Thanks,
-M

So these seem to be different errors from the one originally reported. 
[~mclark], how are you causing this issue? One of the nephoria/n4j tests? Or a CLI command?

Hi [~lincoln.thomas]
The issue has mainly popped up with tests or operations involving upload-bundle. In CI many people have reported 'load-hvm-image' is failing. I've recently added the --retry euca2ools flag as a default flag for nephoria's euca2ools tests. This is probably masking the occurrence in our  'load-hvm-image' tests.  Not all tools have a retry flag and/or retry flag exposed to the user (such as euca-import-instance, import-volume, euca-bundle-instance, etc). I'm currently porting the 3 import-instance tests over and in that process doing a fair amount of import instance runs. I've seen it pop up a few times in this testing. 
Thanks,
-M

We might be looking at this problem, which seems to have no solution other than the workaround of disabling DHE ciphers. Then again, it's 3 years old, so it may have been fixed and we're looking at something else with the same symptom.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14167508/intermittent-sslv3-alert-handshake-failure-under-python
http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/security-dev/2013-May/007435.html
http://bugs.java.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=7146728  <-- This bug says "fixed" but the discussion doesn't look like there was any actual code changes to fix it. May have been explained away instead, but still causes our problem.
http://bugs.java.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=8014618  <-- This similar bug shows code file that may be a fix (unclear).

I updated bouncy castle to 1.54 and no longer saw this issue. Code changes are required for certificate generation if we want to update to 1.54, we'd need to investigate to see how significant this would be.

https://www.bouncycastle.org/latest_releases.html
https://www.bouncycastle.org/releasenotes.html

EDIT: testing was done using the openssl script, which may not be reproducing the originally reported issue.

Updating bouncy castle to 1.54 causes errors reading the default trust/key stores which would also require code updates.

As an alternative I tested lowering the priority of the bouncy castle provider (i.e. revert part of the fix for EUCA-5833) and I could not reproduce the handshake failure. This is instead of updating the bouncy castle library, so the change tested was only the provider priority, no library change.
Fixed by adding the bouncy castle security provider at the end of the provider list.

Reverted the retries in CI. Now using the previous behavior which should test thousands of uploads per day. Will re-open if this issue pops up again. 
Thanks, 
-M

Re-opening this ticket for additional investigation. The issue has been seen again a few times today in CI image tests. 
Example:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/nephoria-load-hvm-image-test/889/console
Going through the test history now. The cloud above appears to a multi-cluster topo...

[~mclark], since there is a change in 4.3.0 related to use of bouncycastle for SSL I would suggest opening a new issue for any post 4.3.0 work.

Closing this issue, and opened EUCA-12554 to track post 4.3.0 work. 
Thanks,
-M
